title.narrative: OUTPUT 3.1.5 BASIC EDUCATION GOVERNANCE

description.narrative: Output 3.1.5 (Papua) By 2015, most disadvantaged children benefit from an increased access and retention in basic education., which contributes to Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Programme Component Results (PCR) 3.1 By 2015, children and young people especially from vulnerable groups are empowered and equipped with adequate knowledge, basic education and life skills to cope with challenges and opportunities. (KRA 2,3)

mailing-address.narrative: 10th Floor Wisma Metropolitan 2 Jl. Jenderal Sudirman Jakarta 12920

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 3.1.5 (Papua) By 2015, most disadvantaged children benefit from an increased access and retention in basic education.
Percentage of eligible teachers trained on early grade teaching

actual.value: 2015:All grade one to three teachers in the 120 pilot schools have received initial training from the mobile trainers team and school based mentors. However, the process is ongoing and the target can be described as met only after the one year training course is completed in June 2016.

title.narrative: Percentage of targeted schools that adapt and apply student learning outcome assessment tool specific for Papua and West Papua

target.value: 2014:Technical assistance being recruited for the development of early grade learning outcome assessment system specific for Papua and West Papua.

actual.value: 2015:Early grade learning outcome assessment system is being piloted in 120 schools in the ongoing academic year.

title.narrative: Student attendance rate in selected 40 schools in selected six districts in Papua and West Papua

actual.value: 2015:The final design of the pilot programme included 120 schools. The pilot programme could only be started from the academic year 2015/2016. Hence, the actual change in the student attendance can only be analysed after the completion of the academic year in July 2016.
